newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy 3rd mobile phone tender by June -minister.
newsitem.headline: Italy 3rd mobile phone tender by June -minister.

text.p: Italian Posts and Telecommunications Minister Antonio Maccanico on Friday confirmed that a tender offer for the country's third mobile phone licence will take place by June.

Maccanico told reporters that the regulations covering various European Union directives necessary to get the tender underway had already been approved by parliament and now only needed the cabinet's go-ahead which was expected very soon.
"So the tender offer will be able to start by June," he said.

Several companies have expressed interest in the third operating licence including Italian multi-media group Mediaset, in partnership with British Telecom and Italian bank BNL in the Albacom joint venture.
Italy currently has two mobile phone service operators, state-controlled Telecom Italia Mobile (TIM) and Olivetti -controlled Omnitel Pronto Italia.
